intro: Gymnosphaera alticola, commonly known as the alpine gymnosphaera, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Podostomata and is characterized by its unique morphology, including its flattened, disk-like structure. The plant typically grows in shallow, fast-flowing streams and is often found in mountainous regions. Its reproductive structures are closely integrated with its substrate, a feature common among members of its family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Gymnosphaera alticola is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental change.
